name: elsymrelsrel

⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(c0 ∈ SymRels ↔ SymRel(c0)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ c1 →((`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ∈ Rels)↔(`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))))
⊣ (c0 ∈ SymRels ↔(`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ c0 ∈ Rels))
⊣ (SymRel(c0)↔(`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)))

comment: For sets, being an element of the class of symmetric relations ( ~ df-symrels ) is equivalent to satisfying the symmetric relation predicate. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 17-Aug-2021.)
